section.title: Applications of definite integrals
section.subsection:
Area problems and definite integrals
We look at a few applications of the definite integral.
-->
Area between curves
Some words.
Area between curves
Given that f(x) and g(x) are continuous and that f(x) \ge g(x) on the interval from x = a to x = b, the area between the curves f(x) and g(x) from x = a to x = b is given by
\int_a^b \Big(f(x) - g(x)\Big)\,dx
degree-day accumulation
Degree-days are used as a way to measure growth and development in plants and other temperature-dependent species, such as insects.
area between curves
Find the area between the curves f(x) = x^2 and g(x) = x^3 between x = 0 and x = 1.
Average value of a function
Some words.
Average value of a function
The average value for a function f(x) on the interval from x = a to x = b is
\text{average value of f} = \hat f = \dfrac{1}{b-a}\int_a^b \Big(f(x) - g(x)\Big)\,dx
resource use
An oil company describes the rate of change in consumption of oil resources (in billions of barrels) using the equation \dfrac{dc}{dt} = 1.2e^{0.04t} with t = 0 indicating the year 1998.
Using a definite integral, compute the total resource consumption over the first ten years since 1998. Note: If you use u-substitution, be sure to transform the limits of integration, otherwise change back to the original variable!
What is the average rate of consumption over the period?
Repeat these two steps for the next ten years, the period from 2008 to 2018.
resource use - extension
In 1998, the above company estimated 30 billion barrels in the reserve. Compute the definite integral that gives the total consumption over the first T years since 1998,
\int_0^{20} 1.2e^{0.04t}\, dt,
and use the resulting formula to find how many years it will take for the 30 billion barrel supply to be exhausted. Note: Set the result of the definite integral equal to 30 and solve for T.
